title: Turkey to halt military offensive in Syria, after reaching deal with US
text:
US Vice President Mike Pence says Turkey has agreed to a ceasefire (Picture: AP)

Turkey has agreed to suspend its invasion of northern Syria, US Vice President Mike Pence has said.

All military operations will be suspended for 120 hours while American forces oversee an ‘orderly withdrawal’ of Kurdish-led fighters.

The US brokered agreement allows for militants to be moved away from a ‘safe zone’, where Turkey wants to return millions of Syrian refugees.

Turkish fighter jets and thousands of troops were sent across the border last week in a bid to erradicate a ‘threat of terror’ from militia groups.

The Syrian Democratic Forces, led by the Kurdish YPG, are a trusted ally of the US and were instrumental in helping to defeat ISIS.

Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan in talks with Pence at Ankara’s Presidential Palace (Picture: Reuters)

Members of Turkish Armed Forces (TSK) crossed the border into northern Syria last week (Picture: Anadolu Agency/Getty Images)

But The Turkish government sees them as terrorists and as an extension of the banned Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK), which has has fought for indepence in Turkey for decades.

After four hours of negotiations with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Pence remained silent on whether the agreement ammounted to an abandonment of the US’ former Kurdish allies in the fight against ISIS.

Pence and US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo lauded the deal as a signigicant achievement and Donald Trump tweered that it was a ‘great day for civilisation’.

Under the ceasefire agreement, once Kurdish forces are cleared from the area, Turkey has committed to a permanent cease-fire but is under no obligation to withdraw its troops.

One US official said this was tantamount to allowing the country’s military to occupy the safe zone.

Turkey launched airstrikes on their neighbour after the US withdrew troops from the border (Picture: AP)

US Vice President Mike Pence and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced the plan at a press conference at the American Embassy in Ankara (Picture: Anadolu Agency/Getty Images)

The deal, which Kurdish forces were not party to, also gives Turkey relief from US imposed economic sanctions.

It is not immediately clear if the YPG would have complied if they were given the chance to have their say.

Before the talks, the Kurds indicated they would object to any agreement along the lines of what the US were suggesting.

But Pence maintained that the US had obtained ‘repeated assurances from them that they’ll be moving out’.

More than 100,000 people in northern Syria have fled their homes to take shelter in makeshift camps after the invasion, sparking fears of a humanitarian crisis.

Turkey see the YPG as terrorists, but they were instrumental in defeating ISIS (Picture: Anadolu Agency/Getty Images)

The two statesman shake hands at the ceasefire talks (Picture: AP)

Turkey launched the assault just three days after Trump announced he would be withdrawing his troops from the border with Syria.

Following mass outcry across the globe, Pompeo said the controversial move was not intended as a ‘green light’ for the invasion.

During the chaos of Turkish mortar strikes, ISIS prisoners escaped from a prison in the city of Qamishli.

It followed reports of the SDF halting its operations against remanents of the terror group to hold off the invasion.

description: US Vice President Mike Pence says Turkey has agreed to suspend its invasion of northern Syria to allow Kurdish-led fighters to move.
